1:
Yahweh, for David's sake call to mind\q all his afflictions.
\q
2:
Call to mind how he swore to Yahweh,\q how he vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob.


\q
3:
He said, "I will not enter my house\q or get into my bed,
\q
4:
I will not give sleep to my eyes\q or rest to my eyelids
\q
5:
until I find a place for Yahweh,\q a tabernacle for the Mighty One of Jacob."


\q
6:
See, we heard about it in Ephrathah;\q we found it in the fields of Jaar.
\q
7:
We will go into God's tabernacle;\q we will worship at his footstool.
\q
8:
Arise, Yahweh, to your resting place,\q you and the ark of your strength!


\q
9:
May your priests be clothed with integrity;\q may your faithful ones shout for joy.
\q
10:
For your servant David's sake,\q do not turn away from your anointed king.


\q
11:
Yahweh swore a sure oath to David,\q a sure oath that he will not revoke:
\q "I will place one of your descendants on your throne.
\q
12:
If your sons keep my covenant\q and the laws that I will teach them,
\q their children also will sit on your throne forevermore."


\q
13:
Certainly Yahweh has chosen Zion,\q he has desired her for his seat.
\q
14:
"This is my resting place forever.\q I will live here, for I desire her.


\q
15:
I will abundantly bless her with provisions.\q I will satisfy her poor with bread.
\q
16:
I will clothe her priests with salvation,\q her faithful ones will shout aloud for joy.


\q
17:
There I will make a horn to sprout for David\q and set up a lamp for my anointed one.
\q
18: I will clothe his enemies with shame,\q but on him his crown will shine."
